revised_title: Tides of Arctic Seas and Musical Duodenes
tldr: This article discusses tidal observations made in the Arctic Seas by Sir Edward Belcher in 1853. It also presents a theory of constructing musical instruments with fixed tones in just or practically just intonation, called "Musical Duodenes." The author, Rev. Samuel Haughton, believes this theory to be entirely new and applicable to instruments with three or four performers.
